data.title: Caesar Box Cipher
data.statement:
Once upon a time, the well-known Julius Caesar created a cipher, which later was called "Caesar Box".
The task is to help his nephew, Augustus in decoding this powerful cipher.
To decode the message, you have to follow three steps:
    1) Count the length of the given message
    2) Place the letters of the message into a square grid, from left to right and top to bottom.
    3) Read the message from the resulting grid from top to bottom and left to right.

EXAMPLE FOR DECODING : 

I. Given a string {{CiaonmdGe}} (9 characters)

II.Divide it in equals rows and columns (here 3 rows, 3 columns):
{{Cia}}
{{onm}}
{{dGe}}

III. Print the concatenation of all the columns, from top do bottom, from left to right in one line :
{{CodinGame}}

Good luck with decoding!

Goal

Once upon a time, the well-known Julius Caesar created a cipher, which later was called "Caesar Box".
The task is to help his nephew, Augustus in decoding this powerful cipher.

1) Count the length of the given message
2) Place the letters of the message into a square grid, from left to right and top to bottom.
3) Read the message from the resulting grid from top to bottom and left to right.

EXAMPLE FOR DECODING :

I. Given a string CiaonmdGe (9 characters)

II.Divide it in equals rows and columns (here 3 rows, 3 columns):
Cia
onm
dGe

III. Print the concatenation of all the columns, from top do bottom, from left to right in one line :
CodinGame

Input
A string message. The square root of number of characters in the string will always be an integer.
Output
Decoded message
Constraints
2*2 <= message length <= 20*20
Example
Input

Output
CodinGame
